comments.body: This was an oversight in #9732. I forgot to configure dynamic port selection there.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +155,159 @@# Compare the generated Daml ledger export to the example export used in the
# documentation. This functions as both a golden test on ledger exports and to
# make sure that the documentation stays up-to-date.
#
# Normalizes the expected output by removing the copyright header and any

comments.body: Should these comments go on top of the test rule? Spotting comments on inlined scripts can be tricky. Duplicating the comment is probably fine.
That's a good point. I've expanded the top comment and kept the comment in the inline code.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +168,172 @@ACTUAL_ARGS=$$(canonicalize_rlocation $(rootpath :example-export/args.json))
# Normalize the expected file by removing the copyright header and any documentation import markers.
# Normalize the actual output by adding a newline to the last line if missing.
$(POSIX_DIFF) -Naur --strip-trailing-cr <($(POSIX_SED) '1,3d;/^-- EXPORT/d' $$EXPECTED_EXPORT) <($(POSIX_SED) '$$a\\' $$ACTUAL_EXPORT) || {
  echo "$$EXPECTED_EXPORT did not match $$ACTUAL_EXPORT"
